intro: Secamone brevicoronata, commonly known as the short-capped secamone, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apocynaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa, particularly found in countries such as Kenya and Tanzania. The plant is characterized by its compact growth habit, with small, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of fragrant, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories or along riverbanks. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and traditional herbal practices.
